author: staszek.wasiutynski
title: On-Chain Trust
description: Lack of liquidity in real-world investment properties. Buying, selling and managing them is a struggle.

assessments.note:
The proposal starts strong but mixes use-cases and it is unclear how the integration will actually look like. The mentioning of arbitration in the future further confuses the reader who actually knows what arbitration is and how decisions are rendered.
Nonetheless, the proposal has potential to drive adoption if the standard makes sense to people who would build the actual DApps on top of this standard.
Could be interesting if successfully implemented. However smart contracts meeting the real world is not simple.
The proposal is an experiment worth trying since, if successful has a huge scope for scaling. There is every increasing demand for a decentralized market for physical items.

The proposal effectively addresses the challenge and appears to be an innovative concept. I found that the basic premise is valid but was not entirely clear on what would be required to take the project from good idea to widespread use.
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to buy property with Cryptocurrency.

This proposal is a great idea that getting real use of blockchain and improve the transactions volume on Cardano blockchain,  because I think that a blockchain explorer that clearly shows smart contracts and the interactions with them is a great thing. 
The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users that offer services based on tokens, and  so on.. )
The experience listed and the Github profile does not convey much reason to believe that this proposal can be successfully implemented in the allotted time.

How will you validate the data coming into the smart contracts. Without this everything falls apart. How do you make sure all cash flows go through it and some are not diverted. How to do measure physical work done. How will you deal with defaults on payments.
assessments.reply: I will not validate anything or anyone. System will allow for honest and dishonest actors. It simply does not care. System will produce score based on which listing entity (legal asset owner) you trust explicitly by creating your own network of trust (see my response to second comment).

assessments.note: The proposer Github credentials are good and have the capability to develop the required app for the proposal. The concept is simple and involves adaptation risks. Unless a large number of people are onboarded there will be less utility. Getting a critical mass of users may require advertising efforts.

I feel that the proposer certainly has the skillset required to get the project up and running. The plan appears straightforward if somewhat open ended in terms of the big picture use cases that might be applicable to such a Dapp. The budget is light on detail but seems moderate in relation to requested funds.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is good. The most important is will your requested budget be enough? Please give a breakdown.

The proposal team is skilled only on technology knowledge and there isn't any information on other team members, so in my opinion I suggest to the proposer to involve other people in this project before start-up. I think that exchange functionalities related to blockchain exploring are incredible evolving in the market during the last years, so there are a lot of possibilities for the adoption by the users. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk.

Because the proposal is unclear on the standard to be built, the complexity is difficult to assess. While there is no lack of information, clear information is missing and thus, the proposal lacks focus and unfeasible. The information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
assessments.reply: I think you took my long term goal for my proposal when in fact it is just my vision for the future which is important because it gives you some context and serves as my motivation. My actual proposal which I described in "Plan" section is quite concrete and straightforward.

assessments.note: A more detailed plan on how the smart contract to real world information interface will be managed is required. As is a detailed plan on how the core produce will be built and marketed. Seems unlikely this could be produced for the funds requested. What physical location are you intending on starting in. How are you managing governance?
assessments.reply: No core product is in scope for this project. This project is only one step in that direction but I will not give you any details other that what is neccessery to complete proof of concept set of smart contracts for scenario I described in detail on my proposal page.

assessments.note: The implementation and adaptation will have clear audit trails. The process and the aim are clear.

I have a sneaking suspicion that this proposal is an extremely useful and innovative concept but was not fully able to confirm this by the information provided. The information was however, sufficient to suggest that the project is a good candidate for funding. Whether the project is viable will likely be determined by the work undertaken from this point onward. I feel the proposer has the technical nous to suggest further collaboration and peer review will likely lead to success in the future.

The Roadmap needs more details on the step-by-step action plan, including milestones and KPI'S. 
Will you hire a team to create this platform? How many customers do you plan to onboard by when? When do you plan to release the product?

The proposer provides a detailed step-by-step plan for the technical implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon and uses cases for adoption. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.

solution: Standardized property management on the Cardano. Buy and sell property as equity tokens on Cardano.
experience: I've been working for 10 years as software developer. Last 2.5 years as a full stack developer in a big corp. Plutus pioneer program member.
